Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad services”
Reviews.Author: nenhum_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, near the main attractions in Venice. It is clean and the sike of the room is ok. There are no carpets, but there is only one window (small). The air conditioning and teh heating were off during our stay, but there was no information about it on the site or at booking.com. So, we had cold everynight. The breakfast is not included and it costs 5euros. We did not even try, as it seemed to be very poor. The wifi costs 4euros per 2 hours and is veeeery slow. There is a stair to get from the street to the front desk and no one shows up to help you with the luggage. Our room was next to the elevator and we could hear the femal voice recorded that said eferytime: "third floor, door opening". You can also hear noises from the other rooms. TV too small. Too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very central”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen37
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the last review, as I spent 4 nights here the last week in March. The weather was unseasonally hot (20 - 25dgs C) and I was surprised that the hotel allowed the AC to be on. (there is local governance that AC/Heating can only be on at certain times of year, and AC isn't due to be on til May/June time - it wasn't on in another hotel I moved to in Cannaregio during this trip) The AC unit in my room worked really well, and was a blessing due to the hot weather. Again, everything in my room was lovely. I booked a single but got a very comfortable double. Exceptionally clean, bed very comfy, and nothing worn at all; most stuff and the bathroom looked new. I had a mini fridge in my room, which again was excellent and two windows which looked out onto the little courtyard off reception. I would sit out there in the sun with a book and a cold drink when I came back during the day for a quick rest due to the heat. Lovely!! The towels, like some other hotels I've stayed in, are the thin,white "tea towel" type, but they do the job. I'd read the reviews here before my visit, so was aware of what to expect. The location of this hotel is really excellent. Less than a minute walk from San Marco San Zaccaria vap stop, no bridges to cross (although there is a flight of stairs to reach reception, after that there is a lift to the rooms) All staff, especially the ladies who cleaned the rooms, were lovely and very friendly. Reception staff booked me an evening performance at Teatro san Gallo with no problems at all. If your breakfast isn't included in your room rate, then I'd give it a miss, as it was a simple croissant and bread roll with jam, however, the grapefruit and orange juice were fresh! I decided to stay here this trip as I sometimes like to be close to Piazza San Marco as in the evenings, I love to have a Sgroppino at Quadri's and sometimes appreciate after a busy day, having just a short stroll back to my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than you think! Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Fins A
Reviews.Content: Despite the beautiful pictures in the internet, this hotel is not on the level of a 3-star-hotel and much too expensive for what it is. The room was very small and dark. The furniture, especially the bed, is old and bumpy. There is no duvet, just bed linen. The heating was crazy hot and could not be turned down. The towels in the bathroom are just blankets. The light is cold and unfriendly. Some of the staff is almost not / understanding speaking italian or english. One cold winter evening there was no hot water, but the staff did not announce it or make a discount afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location”
Reviews.Author: yo-no-fui
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel near San Marco square. It was clean, safe and very well located... but... The TV did not offer many channel options ... and you have to pay for the WiFi. As a tip... Bring your own towel, the hotel's towels didn't dry you much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but...”
Reviews.Author: Kilma_01
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right next to St Mark's Square, the Doges Palace and a waterbus station. Very clean hotel and very friendly personnel. However, there were some works down the street and every morning at 8am we were woken up by the sound of a hammer. It would not have been a problem if it was well sound isolated. Other than that the hotel was perfect: comfortable room with enough space for 2 people, affordable for a week and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem...”
Reviews.Author: plumper
Reviews.Content: We booked this through easyjet and arrived before Christmas for a three day break. It was very reasonably priced and in an incredibly central setting. The hotel is easy to find in the calle before the Hotel Danieli. The people on the reception were helpful but not fussy. We had asked for a higher room and were really pleased with room 304 which overlooked the rooftops between the hotel and St Mark's square. We could see the bells from the bed in the room. The room was very clean, everything was white and there were many windows which allowed the room to be flooded with light. The bathroom (which included a bath!) was large and clean. Be prepared to hear the bells at midnight and 7am from St Mark's. This was amazing value for money and I thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good find”
Reviews.Author: trekker243
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night of 6 October before a cruise the following day. The cost for us was 142 euros, which was good for the area. Just down an alley and over one bridge before getting to St. Mark's Square, accessible (over one bridge) to the San Zaccaria water bus stop. Quiet room with air conditioning, typical European bed. The room was large enough for our large suitcases. The hotel was clean. Biggest complaint I've seen is the flight of stairs you have to ascend to get to the front desk. It isn't fun with a couple of large suitcases, but certainly not a deal-killer. There is an elevator after you get past that hurdle. The front desk staff were helpful and we were able to leave our luggage in the lobby the next day. Breakfast was decent and was included in our price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antigo Trovatore - good value for money and great staff”
Reviews.Author: gobbinBolton
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4th â€“ 8th September 2011. The hotel is in an excellent location and we found the staff to be cheerful, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was as described with a happy smiley waitress who provided an assortment of breads and preserves, fruit juices, various tea or various coffees and was it was served promptly. The room although somewhat small was very clean with a comfortable bed, had its own fridge and a balcony to sit out on. The spacious shower room was modern and clean. The steps up to reception were quite steep particularly if you have heavy luggage but a stair lift was available if needed. On numerous occasions we approached the receptionists for help and found them all happy and enthusiastic to offer advice and information about the area, the transport system etc. Wi-Fi is provided free of charge in the hotel and signal strength was strongest in reception but still accessible in our room although it could be intermittent. We found that the username and password changed daily (!?) so approach reception if you are unable to log-on and they will provide you with new ones on a printed sheet. If we visit Venice again we will have no hesitation in staying at Hotel Antigo Trovatore again and have already recommended it to friends. Word of warning concerning the fish restaurant â€˜La Gondolaâ€™ opposite the hotel entrance â€“ although the food was of average quality, the bill was absolutely extortionate as we expected to pay approx. 60-70 euros but ended up paying 127 euros. One of us chose lasagne and salad and the other had a selection of the â€˜fish of the dayâ€™ which was recommended by the waiter and we were assured by him that this would NOT be expensive. Drinks were one bottle of still water and one beer. We were astonished at the price and objected strongly but to no avail. We will NOT be returning to â€˜La Gondolaâ€™ if we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget renovated hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Victor_1961_10
Reviews.Content: It is is very difficult to rate the location of the hotel. On the one hand, very close to San Marco and the vaporetto. On the other hand why you heed this closeness by itself? Service is minimal. We waited for the settling during 4 houers while most visitors of the city are there only 4 hours of less. The room is clean. Very funny towel. The impression that it is cuted pieces of sheets:). My advices are, firstly, to choose a hotel far away from San Marco and to be in the city from 17 pm till 10 am. At other times, the city looks like creepy anthill.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value & excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: laguida
Reviews.Content: We were on a relatively tight budget throughout our trip and therefore never imagined being able to afford to stay at a decent place on the island of Venice for 3 nights. That was until we stumbled across this place and it was fantastic value! Not only were we happy with the fact that it was on the island, but it is also literally only a few footsteps from San Marco. â€¢ Location, location, locationâ€¦love it!! So convenient, close to ferries/vaporettos, the waterfront, and San Marco. We enjoyed seeing San Marco first thing in the morning when thereâ€™s barely anyone around, and late at night when it was totally quiet and emptyâ€¦very romantic. â€¢ The hotel was very easy to find. Enter their full address "Calle delle Rasse 4534, 30122 Venice" into Google Maps and zoom in all the way, this will show you exactly where it is. Do not simply enter "Hotel Antigo Trovatore" into Google Maps, this will point to the wrong place. Basically it's in a small street directly opposite the San Marco vaporetto stop. Very convenient and easy. â€¢ Cute and spacious room, nicely decorated, clean and quiet. We were on the western side of the hotel on one of the upper levels, away from the street, so the only noise we heard was from San Marco's tower ringing - this does stop throughout the night though. â€¢ View of San Marco's tower & the Doge's palace from our room â€¢ All of the staff we met were friendly, helpful and had excellent English. Responsive to emails prior to arriving. â€¢ Wasn't any problem to leave our bags in the lobby for some time after checking out. â€¢ Breakfast was included in our cheap room rate and it was decent Really can't find anything to fault about it! We loved our stay here & ADORED Venice, it was a fantastic couple of days!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the noise was awful”
Reviews.Author: Don1980
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find it intially but after a little bit of friendly advice from a local we was there and as everyone says it is a brilliant location, clean and well worth the money. I did have a few issues the first being the women on reception - we couldn't get her to smile for love nor money! We was given their disabled room which meant the toilet was too tall and the shower too short but quite spacious. Our biggest issue was the noise and therefore the lack of sleep - you can hear everything from the busy street below so take earplugs. Overall I would recommend this hotel for the location just be prepared to comprimise on other things.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, nice view, just a mix-up with payment”
Reviews.Author: LittleAndMegsy
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the size of our room (double bed and a single) and the clean bathroom. The bed was made and we were provided with fresh towels each day. Our room had 4 large windows that overlooked a narrow street and a glimpse of the roof of the Doges Palace and we could hear the bell tower in San Marco ring. Breakfast was adequate and consisted of croissants, bread, toast, coffee/tea and fruit juice (some fresh fruit would've been a nice addition). This hotel is reasonably easy to access from the ferry, it's about a 7 minute walk and there are only 2 bridges (along the Grand Canal). We were disappointed that the advertised free wi-fi was a computer in the hotel foyer - even with the wi-fi code we couldn't connect to the network from our room and got a different explanation from the staff each time we questioned them. This was the only accommodation in our 6 week trip through Europe that we didn't have wi-fi in our room. On checking out, there was a misunderstanding that we had pre-paid for our room and we were in fact charged a second time. Hotel staff were quick to organise a refund, however the transfer from the bank took a while to come through.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: ronniemarks
Reviews.Content: rooms were basic as per the star rating but clean and comfortable. Great location to find from the water bus / taxi station and couple of minutes walk to St Marks square. Would recommend if this is the budget you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fair choice”
Reviews.Author: NgHoMan
Reviews.Content: Located close to a waterbus station and to the main attractions. The room is clean and reasonably big ( for 2 people). The only problem is that air-con is not on ( the staff said is only avaliable after May) and we need to open the windows. That attracted mosquitos which made us bad sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: perhapsy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Antigo Trovatore for 2 nights from 29 - 31 March. I booked it right after purchasing my Easyjet tickets, I suppose they have a deal going on but in any case this little hotel turned out to be a total gem: 1. Total value for money! We paid less than 100 euros (total) for 2 nights in a double ensuite room. The room was spacious, very clean and because we were on the second floor, our window opened to the rooftops of Venice with the tip of the famous St Marco bell tower visible over them. Below our windows was one of the narrow alleyways of Venice - if you left them open you could listen to the bustle outside and enchanting chatter in Italian by shopkeepers and restaurant owners. Note though, that our offer did not include breakfast, but we were offered the option for 5 euros per person if we so opted. Personally I think it's best to head out and enjoy expresso and a pastry at one of the small coffee places along any of the canals. 2. The room was tidy, clean, and charming. Equipped with all the necessities - a TV, safe, mini-fridge, dressing table, lovely double bed with intricately wired head board. Had two large windows which let in the sun quite a bit in the afternoon (we stayed on the second floor). Hairdryer's not the best though but for the price I think it's amazing already. Basic bar soap and gel shampoo provided, best to bring your own than to rely on it. The only tiny downside was a missing kettle, although you could easily buy hot water downstairs for 5 cents per cup. 3. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. If you want to fully enjoy Venice and be drawn into its allure, I think it is crucial to stay on the main island itself. Hotel Antigo Trovatore is even better - it is literally 2 canals/alleys away from St Marco and takes 2 minutes to get there - and along the way you will pass by the lovely Bridge of Sighs. Also easily accessible by water bus (stop: San Zaccaria) if you get lost somewhere in Venice and manage to get hold of a water bus stop. One big plus of staying at the hotel is that you get to catch the early rays hit St Marco square before any of the other hoards of tourists arrive. It is also extremely romantic to wander along the water front which takes 1 minute to arrive at from the hotel. Definitely the best location to indulge in the beauty and charm of Venice. All in all, extremely recommended - because of its amazing location, wonderful value and lovely interior I think my holiday to Venice has been one of the best ever. Absolutely love it, and would recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in Venice. One thing though - I got the extra special offer because I booked my rooms through Easyjet, I'm not sure what rates they usually offer but I suppose they are relatively decent anyhows. Check on the Easyjet website to see if the special offer still exists!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but...”
Reviews.Author: Suzieq3344
Reviews.Content: Like all the reviews before me i agree, this hotel is in an excellent location. However there are a few things to be wary of. Room 1 is a claustrophics nightmare - tiny, stuffy, and there are no blinds, so dont open the window shutters!! The room was so hot that even with the a/c on 18 degrees celcius, it was still too hot to sleep with more than a sheet. Even though europe is reknown for its hard flat pillows, these ones take the cake. So hard and so hot that it was impossible to sleep well and therefore made touring round the next day a grumpy affair. Oh and dont get caught out by the offer of "free wifi" you get the 1st two hours free only on the first day, then they slug you for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, comfy room, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tonteapot
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Trovatore for 4 nights and loved it. The hotel was really easy to find and only a few metres away from the actv vaparetto stop San Zaccharia and the airport stop with Alilaguna stop. The rooms are really clean and fresh with great air conditioning. the bathrooms are clean and comfortable. the fridge in the room was also a bonus. the street outside and the surrounding streets are lively with a supermarket nearby. the staff were helpful. the breakfast was continental -coffee, tea hot choc and toast, cereals and breads with jams and honey. the hotel was only about 2 mins walk from St Marks square which made it a gerat stop for a break then back out into venice. i would def recommend this hotel. we found the bed the most comfortable we have ever slept in! a great hotel at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what to think about this?”
Reviews.Author: HMK101
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel almost 2 months in advance. When we arrived (with voucher in my hand) they explained that they are fully booked. They redirected us to another hotel with less standard. I wanted to see a manager but never got to do that. I'm too tired to write about this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: montom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed just for a weekend in Venice and had chosed this hotel due to excellent location, walking distance to everywhere (if you like walking ofcourse). Staff was very nice and helpful; room in decent size for few days stay, very clean. Take your own towel if you do not wish use something like kitchen towel (I read it in someone else review and found it veru useful advice). Basic continental breakfast, so do not expect 'full english'. I would recomend this hotel and definitelly come back there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - but backache since”
Reviews.Author: C_Caper73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. We stayed for a few nights. The staff is friendly and they are why I am giving the hotel a good rating. My complaint: the beds are like sleeping on the floor. Both my husband and I are still suffering their effects a week later. We're both on pain meds with hurt necks and shoulders. The beds consist of a stiff mattress (and I mean stiff) on a frame. No box-spring. The pillows are about 2 inches thick. Strolling through Venice would have been a lot more enjoyable had I been able to turn my neck.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: anfield_d
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights with my wife and will recommend to everyone. Very clean and cosy rooms, furnished with style. Good breakfast. The staff is helpfull and nice. But the best of all is location - few steps from San Marco square , close to main vaporetto(public transport) station and on walking distance to all the main attractions and historic sites. Excellent place to stay in Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in central location.”
Reviews.Author: SwedeLisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and inlaws for 2 nights in August. We had read so much about how expensive Venice is, so when we got an incredibly good deal in this hotel, our expectations were very low. But we were pleasantly surprised. A little tricky to find at first, because it was our first time in Venice, but very central, just by Piazza San Marco. The joy of walking in through the airconditioned entrance! The hotel is clean, roomy and basic, and so was our room. No frills, but good standard, with the very important aircondition. There is an enclosed terrace, where we sat in the evening, enjoying wine we had bought on tap during the day. (Not very classy buying it in PET bottles haha, but very tasty and cheap.) The breakfast was basic, verging on poor. I would definitely stay here again if I got the same sort of deal- we paid 85 euro a night for a double room, breakfast included! I have to add that Venice itself was a positive surprise, I had heard so much about it being expensive, smelly and crammed with tourists. There was no smell at all. Transport is expensive, but buy a travelpass for the boats first thing when you arrive, it makes it easier. (We had 1 1/2 days free travel left on our passes when we were leaving, so we gave them to an arriving couple.) Anyway- you can walk most places, Venice is small, and this is the best way to experience it. There are free maps in the trainstation tourist office- very useful! Don't miss taking the boat over to the island Lido, where there is a long sandy public beach. The water is ment to be dirty, but I don't know how true that is. Venice is full of tourists, but if you just choose the sidestreets it is surprisingly quiet. Food and drink in restaurants is expensive and not great- but the small supermarkets and wine shops are good and cheap! We asked in the hotel for our nearest supermarket, and we bought our water and snacks there cheaply. For lunch we bought something in a bakery, and had it sitting on secluded piers by the canals, feeding the fish. Very romantic, and really lovely. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel with beautiful rooms, right in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: pinkkatie
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel - we stayed for four nights in a beautiful big room with views of the Doge's Palace and San Marco, for 140 Euros per night. The staff were generally very friendly (just make sure you're not late to breakfast!) and the hotel was clean and well-kept. It is on a small but busy street right by St Mark's - but when you get inside, it's very quiet and calm. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tony500
Reviews.Content: Just beside S.Marco square. Our room was very nice and always clean. Staff is very professional. So cheap and high quality. Thank you for the magic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Adelle123
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable bed, quiet rooms. Upgrading to a terrace (shared) room was vell worth it. We never saw any one else on the terrace and were very surprised that the hotel didn't seem very busy. Its a bargain at Â£100 (nothing in Venice is cheap!) and should really get another star. Down sides: very basic breakfast, air conditioning was almost too cold at times and temperature couldn't be easily regulated overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: tokeefe5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, staff are very friendly and helpful and speak a number of languages. The rooms are clean and big(ish) with excellent air conditioning units. For the price you pay you get more than your moneys worth. The only drawback it the flight of stairs at the front leading into the hotel its quite big, so elderly people or people with disabilities may have difficulty accessing the hotel. The breakfasts were good, good selection of breads criossants yoghurts etc. A variety of juices and tea and coffee are avaible also. The big attraction of this hotel has to be the location right in the heart of venice next to the main square, piazza san marco. it takes you less than 5 minutes to walk to san marco from the front door of the hotel. from our balcony in the hotel you could see the campanile (bell tower) and the back of the basilica. When i go back to venice i will definately stay in this hotel Hotel antigo trovatore is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location - Antigo Trovatore, Venice”
Reviews.Author: PerthTripper
Reviews.Content: Location is everything, and this place is probably the best-located hotel in Venice. The room was small and basic, but very clean and comfortable. It was airconditioned, which was good as there is a fair bit of noise from local cafes. Closing the windows kept out the noise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. As mentioned in other reviews, it is a long steep flight of stairs to the reception, and the lift doesn't stop at every floor. If you are elderly or disabled, that is a major consideration, but for most people it's just a minor niggle. With that proviso, we'd have no hesitation recommending this fine little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I have just returned back from Venice after staying 4 nights at the 2* Hotel Antigo Trovatore. Usually, we stay in 4*/5* accommodation as we think after working hard all year we want to stay somewhere nice, however, our stay at the hotel was great. Obviously I was apprehensive prior to arriving but I would really recommend the hotel without hesitation. We stayed in room 11 on the 1st floor with 2 windows overlooking the courtyard below. The room itself was simple but had everything we needed and was big enough for all of us. The room also had air-conditioning which was essential in late July. The bathroom was small with shower, toilet, sink & bidet but once again very clean. Towels were provided but as a previous reviewer commented they do resemble a cotton tablecloth (very thin) however they do get you dry! Breakfast was a simple affair of breads with a selection of jam, pate etc, yogurts, fruit juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate etc. Again, a simple affair but this is a 2* hotel and I have had worse breakfasts in higher rated hotels. The reception staff were great and very helpful. We asked about places to go and Jessica on reception mapped out an itinerary for us which turned out to be really great and was full of useful tips. The major plus about this hotel is the location. You are literally 2 minutes from St Marks Square. The ferry stop (S.Zaccaria) is literally at the end of the street on the Grand Canal. Here you can get a boat to Murano and then on to Burano and Torcello (all recommended). You can also catch a boat to Venice Lido from here which is highly recommended as it has a completely different feel to Venice in that there are great beaches and the whole place is far more relaxed. I suggest you buy a 1, 3 or 7 day pass as they represent good value for money. Also, when you arrive at Marco Polo airport most people get the Alilaguna boat to the centre of Venice. We did this and it dropped us off at the Marco Polo stop which is a 5 minute walk to the hotel (very close) so for ease of travel I would definitely recommend using this service. To sum up I would really recommend the Hotel Antigo Trovatore. We booked through hotelclub.com and paid Â£322.00 for 4 nights accommodation on a special deal for 3 adults. I think for this price the hotel represented excellent value for money. It is a basic hotel but very clean and with an enviable location (you can see the 5* Danielli Hotel through the front windows of the hotel and the bridge of sighs is in the next street). Venice is an expensive place so if you can find somewhere comfortable like this it just means youâ€™ve got more money to spend enjoying yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer55
Reviews.Content: My family of three adults stayed in a triple room for 2 nights. The room was small, but very clean. The hotel is very well located and the service from the female day clerk was outstanding: she provided very helpful and friendly advice, particularly on which tours to take. The only downside was having to haul our luggage up and down a half flight of stairs, but by now we were used to having to do this in Europe. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location could not have been bettered, 100 yards away from the 5 star Hotel Danieli, so rubbing shoulders with one of the most luxurious hotels in Venice. 2 minutes walk to San Marco Square and very close, only 100 yards, to a main vaporetto stop. The rooms were basic but spotlessly clean with excellent shower. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast a little uninspiring but at Â£50 per room per night for the location, I would definitely recommend it. However, beware, steep flight of stairs to reach the reception.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Antigo Trovatore
HotelInfo.Address: Calle delle Rasse 4534, 30122 Venice, Italy
